column1: good length outside off, defended to cover point on the front foot
back of a length and pushed straight through outside off, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length arm ball outside off, drifts away from him and beats the outside edge on the cut
length and drifting away like an outswinger, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, no shape away this time, goes straight through. He plays for the spin on the front foot, beaten on the outside edge
back of a length, shaping away. Dropped to point with soft hands and a quick call for the run
good length at middle stump, he gets down quickly, not as circumspect as he was against Nabi because this is going to pitch outside leg. Hoicks it away with a sweep, wide of deep mdiwicket
bowled him! Backs away this time, exposes the stumps and goes for the sweep again. But he's missed this arm ball. It pitches leg and skids under his shot as it heads middle stump
back of a length outside off, no feet movement, tapped hurriedly to point
back of a length skidder in at middle stump, no feet again as he closes the face and gets this awkwardly to square leg
length outside off, lifts it inside-out over extra cover, very very high. It plonks into the surface a few yards inside the boundary
back of a length outside off, punched to mid-off
back of a length outside off, swings away from outside off. Nudged to cover on the up
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
back of a length at off stump, doesn't quite get down for the sweep. It's a short-arm whip on the up, but it beats deep midwicket to the right
good length at off stump, floated away from off stump. Pushed to mid-on
short of a length outside off, watches it onto the bat and slices late to beat cover point's dive and backward point's chase
back of a length at middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
dug in short at off stump, pushed off his toes into the midwicket region
good length, hooping in at middle stump. Drags it to midwicket off the inside half of the bat
short of a length at off stump, and this time he hangs deep in the crease in order to get under it. Manages it well and slaps it over the bowler, on the rise
back of a length in the corridor, similar ball to the last one but this time he looks to go leg side. Misses the pull

taken at extra cover. Three different shots to similar deliveries. This time he looks to get the front leg out of the way and slash it over mid-on as it climbs at an off stump line. Cramped for room and he slices it for Finch at extra cover, who skips backwards and holds on
back of a length at leg stump, clipped off the hips to deep square's right
yorker first up, in at off stump. Jams it out into the off side
good length and in at the pads, neatly pushed to deep square's left
back of a length at off stump, looks to dab it into the off side for a quick single but times it too well
good length at off stump, punched to mid-off. Timed well again and looks like it'll be close as he sprints to halfway down the pitch. But Nabi doesn't gather the ball as he swoops down on it
back of a length in the corridor, looks to go too square with the pull shot, beaten
good length at off stump, punched to short extra on the front foot
full at off stump, driven crisply on the rise but straight to Finch at short extra, who swivels and shies at the non-striker's end. Has Labushagne diving to make his ground. That would've been close
clean bowled. Another whip across the line to an off stump ball, bat facing square leg. This is a fuller ball, angled in at off stump, and smashes it hard
full and in at middle stump, big backlift as he taps this to mid-on
short ball outside off, cut straight to point
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers on the up
back of a length at leg stump, pushed out to deep square off the inside half of the bat
brings out the reverse sweep first up and executes well. Hogg tosses one up at middle stump, he swivels quickly and swats this to the deep point boundary
full at middle stump, pushed to long-off on the front foot
wrong'un, floated up at off stump. He doesn't reach the pitch of this as he looks to drive. Sliced uppishly to sweeper cover
full outside off, swept along the turf to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, punched to long-off off the back foot
floated up at middle stump, flicked forcefully off his toes to midwicket
74kph, back of a length floater outside off. Doesn't come on as he looks to punch off the back foot. Hits it straight back at the bowler
back of a length at middle stump, pushed through midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, tickled to short fine off the back foot
loopy full ball at off stump, takes ages to come on. Defended on the front foot
106kph, pushes this through quickly at leg stump, it's stabbed to short fine's left
back of a length at off stump, chipped off the back foot towards long-off
slower ball, full and looping at leg stump. Flicked to deep square
full at middle stump, flicked to long-on's right
slower full ball almost beats him. He picks it late and pushes this into the off side
slower length ball at off stump, gets the front foot out of the way and slaps it to long-off
full and swinging in at off stump, driven to long-off
waits on the slower ball and pummels it to the midwicket fence. It's an overpitched ball that he meets nicely at the pitch and whips over the infielder. Nicely timed
back of a length outside off. Taps it into the covers, says 'yes' and takes off. Non-striker says no and sends him back after he covers nearly half the pitch
good length at leg stump, tapped to long-on on the rise
big outside edge sails past the keeper. Back of a length ball in the corridor with no room for a cut. But he takes it on with a big slash
back of a length in the corridor, bunted to long-on off the inside half
slower ball, full at off stump. Pushed to extra cover from the crease
back of a length at off stump, punched to long-off off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, slices the reverse sweep towards backward point that spins away rapidly from Hodge backward point and forces him to lunge at it. He gets a hand and keeps it to two
full at middle stump, swept to deep square along the floor
good length at middle stump, leans into this and chips it over the umpire to come back for the second

wrong'un beats him and we have an appeal for stumping that's been sent upstairs. He looks to play a similar shot as the last ball, trying to chip it straight. But this one spins past the outside edge and drags his back toe up. It appears like he's brought it down in time though...yes. Not out.
good length outside off, steps out and can't make it to the pitch. Taps it to extra cover
full at middle stump, shapes to sweep, adjusts rapidly to bring a straighter bat and jams it out to midwicket
good length at off stump, tapped to extra cover's right
back of a length outside off, dabbed straight to backward point to steal a single
full outside off, walks into the off side, big front leg across, and pokes it to deep midwicket
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Can't get a lot of bat on the cut. Finds point

late on the shot and loses his leg stump. It's a length ball coming in at him. He shapes up to play an expansive shot and decides against it. Tries to bring down the full face but it's too late. Wildermuth skids through his defences and picks up his third
good length in the corridor, defended solidly down the pitch
79kph, length ball at off that turns away from the right hander. He drags it out to the sweeper with a reverse sweep
full at middle stump, swept to square leg's left

first six of the evening. Gets one in the slot, tossed up generously at middle stump. It's too full for even the slow pitch to help him out once it lands there. The batsman gets the front leg out of the way and heaves it into the crowd at deep midwicket crowd
top edge as he looks to reverse sweep this full one at middle stump, finds backward point on the bounce and Cutting survives the run out attempt
full at middle stump, driven back to the bowler's right, towards long-on
full at off stump, half-sweep, straight to square leg
full outside off stump, gloriously driven to long-off for a single
short and wide outside off, third man is in, point is in - he chops this between those two
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, whipped between deep midwicket and long-on. Bowler doesn't gather the throw as Cutting comes back. That would've been close if he's managed to take the bails off
short ball outside off, skids through from under the cut shot
slower ball, good length at leg stump. Checks his swipe across the line and pushes to short fine
low full toss outside off, a big echo as he drags this to long-on off the toe of the bat
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
yorker at off stump, squeezed out to long-on off the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, late cut to short third man's right. It seems to run away but old Hodgey dives to his right to cut it off
full and in at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
yorker at off stump, driven to long-off
full and in at leg stump, driven to long-on
short ball in at the chest, uses the pace and half-ramps, half-pulls this over the long leg fence
short ball outside off, lines up and swings hard with the pull but he can't get bat on it

back-of-the-hand slower ball, floated full at middle stump. He picks it and he hammers it flat over the long-on boundary, where the fielder is a few yards in. Might not have got to that even if he was fully back
slower ball, back of a length at off stump. Sets up for the slog but adjusts to tap it into the off side with soft hands
slower ball, length at leg stump. Tickled to short fine off the pads
wrong'un, back of a length outside off. Very very slow that one. 68kph. Pushed to extra cover's right
yorker fired in at leg stump. He looks to sweep but falls over because he's squeezed for room. It deflects off the pad and runs away fine. Lbw appeal turned down

gets him with a juicy full toss! Floated up nicely, thigh height, at middle stump. Cutting looks to slam it out of the stadium but with hard hands and a lot of elevation, he can only get it out as far as the deep midwicket fielder. What a big blow this is to the Heats' chances of a big finish
full toss at leg stump, backs away and drives to long-off

gets him first ball with a wrong'un. Superb bowling from Hogg. Back of a length, turning away from the right hander outside off. He's playing for the turn. Looks to flick this through midwicket but it climbs on him, comes off the leading edge and is taken at slip
back of a length in the corridor, pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
short slower ball in the corridor, waits for it arrive and ramps it off this throat to third man
full and wide outside off, looks to chop it square on the off side but he's late bringing the bat down
attempted yorker heads down leg side, but he stretches his bat out and bunts it over short fine on the full
slower full toss outside off, steps out and nearly takes his eyes off this as it appears to be a beamer. Then it dips on him. He adjusts to push it out to deep midwicket
low full toss at leg stump, whipped flat towards deep midwicket and lands short of Nabi there
slower ball, in the corridor, back of a length. Can't beat short third man with the late cut
good length at leg stump, whipped uppishly towards deep square leg
short ball down leg side, steps out and swings across the line. Beaten on the inside edge
nicely played. Midwicket was in the circle, so it was going to be short. He stepped out again and wafted this from a body line, over midwicket
slower ball at leg stump, would've been in line but the batsman moved across into the off side and has got a wide after missing this
full outside off, steps out and jams this on the full, straight to extra cover
shot. Overpitched outside off, keeps the front leg out of the way and thumps this flat over the bowler's head
does him with the slower one. It dips on him, full outside off stump. He's through the slog early and it lobs up nicely for the fielder at point

bowled him! Dwayne Bravo is on a hat-trick. Full and in at off stump. Ross is probably expecting the slower ball because he's late on this slog. Misses it completely and the Bravo lights up the stumps
slower ball, full outside off. Looks to run it through third man with an open face, beaten
slower ball, dips down and nearly sneaks through from under his bat. He somehow toe-pokes this back down the pitch with a big stretch
slower ball, short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
low full toss, shapes in at the pads and all he has to do is turn swing his bat at it and make a connection. He does, and it dribbles past short fine to push them past 130
good length slider down leg side, looks to flick as he pushes out of the crease. Tickles it fine off the pad
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
length at off stump, another skidder. Defended into the covers
back of a length, straight through across the off stump. Plays for the turn and looks to flick. Beaten
misfield at deep midwicket gives them a boundary. It's a short ball at middle stump, he gets good bat on this pull shot. Heazlett over-runs this in the deep
googly, back of a length at middle stump. Bunted back down the pitch off the back foot
back of a length, fired down leg side. He can't get bat on that
back of a length at off stump, drops it into the off side off the back foot. The non-striker wants a run, he's sent back and the shy at the non-striker's end results in an overthrow

dropped! Cutting puts it down at first slip. A straightforward take, and he reacts late. This is a length ball swinging away from the corridor. He looks to drive on the up and gets a healthy edge that carries at knee height
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, clipped past midwicket from the crease to pick up two
oh sensational. Angles it into the corridor at a length and gets it to straighten as Finch offers the full face to try and drive this past the bowler
back of a length outside off, looks to pull, beaten on the inside edge
googly, length outside off. Tapped to point on the up
full toss outside off, hurriedly stabbed to backward point
length ball at leg stump, looks to flick but deflects it into the leg side off the front pad
short and wide outside off, backs away to make room and hammers this cut in front of point
googly, pushed down leg side, he can't get bat on it

topspinner, back of a length and climbing sharply in the corridor. He backs away to play the cut again, but it's skidding off the pitch and he can't get the bat above this. Thin edge, big appeal and the umpire raises the finger
googly, good length and outside off. Defended on the front foot
back of a length wide outside off, big inside edge into the leg side as he looks to guide this on the up through the covers
full ball, fired down leg side. He leans into the off side, makes room down leg, and clips it past short fine
full at leg stump, checks the flick, tucks it past midwicket to deep square's left
good length outside off, looks to get under this and carve it inside-out over the cover. Beaten
good length outside off, swipes across it to drag it out to deep square off the inside half
superbly timed. Full ball on the pads, flicked with full balance to deep square's left
full outside off, watchfully pushed to mid-off's left
full outside off, flicked to square leg's left off the front foot

rattles middle stump! Not the greatest of deliveries, but Harris has appeared tentative against Shadab all through. It's a short ball at middle stump, prime for the pull. But he backs way, is caught in two minds and plays an aimless shovel with an angled bat. Shadab gets it to skid through and send him back
googly outside off, not picked as he looks to drive on the up with no feet. Inside edge onto pad
full at leg stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length at off stump, pushed to short extra's right
good length, in at leg stump. Can't get enough bat on the flick. It rolls into the leg side off the pad
full at middle stump, punched on the rise to mid-on
short ball outside off. Gets back and across and really heaves at this with all his might to place the pull wide of deep square. You don't get much from this pitch as a batsman
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot. It's a no-ball. You know what that means...
short ball outside off, nicely on top of the bounce to thump this to the square boundary on the off side off the back foot. Glorious timing from White, vintage stuff
yorker at off stump, tapped into the covers
another full one, in at off stump. Watchfully pushed back to the bowler
good length at off stump, driven on the up to long-off
back of a length at leg stump, looks to whip off the back foot. Deflected to short fine off the thigh guard
short ball at off stump, cut straight to backward point
dropped short down leg side, guided straight to short fine
back of a length at off stump, chopped straight to point
good length at off stump, looks for it skid on and plays the paddle sweep, but this spins past his shot and the off stump
full delivery outside off, 134 kph, beats White for pace, toe-ended to the keeper as White attempts to drive
full and wide that time, there is no one out there in the deep. White slashes a cut between point and third man. Poor option from Lalor
full around off, the line adjustment is better, driven to long-on
better length, fuller than good. Outside off. Punched to cover
shortish delivery down leg, 121 kph, pulled down to fine leg
on a length, around off, tapped towards point with soft hands for one. Good tip and run cricket
oooooohhh yessssssss! Sweet from White. Big front foot plonk down the track, reaches the pitch of this at off stump and smacks the slog sweep to clear deep midwicket
full at off stump, driven to sweeper cover on the front foot
tossed up outside off, driven firmly to long-off's left
77 kph, floated up nicely at a Test match line and length. Defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length outside off, pushed into the leg side off the back foot
good length, slider outside off. Sliced to point on the up
slower ball, short and wide outside off. Chops it into the turf towards backward point
yorker at off stump, squeezed out to long-off
short slower ball outside off, dragged to deep square leg with a pull, on the bounce
good length in the corridor, dropped into the off side with soft hands to steal a single from Baz
nicely bowled. In the blockhole at middle stump, pushed back down the pitch
slower ball, overpitched wide outside off. Stretches out and slaps it like a hockey ball. Sweeper cover sprints to his right and puts in a full-stretch slide to keep it in
back of a length outside off, goes in early for the reverse sweep and adjusts well to tap it on it's head to get it to short third man's left
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
googly gone wrong, full toss at off stump. Thumped back down the pitch and straight into the stumps. Bowler didn't get a hand on that . Would've been out if he had
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, steps out and goes inside-out to try and get it wide of long-off. Can't quite manage it. It lands just short of that fielder
googly, rips in sharply. Cooper had no idea. Was looking to cut and somehow he's managed to get bat on that to keep it out
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to deep square from the crease
back of a length at off stump, pushed to mid-off on the up
good length in the corridor, dead-batted into the pitch
good length at middle stump, pushed through the mid-on region with the full face

well placed. Cooper breaks free. Backs into the off side, exposes the stumps with no danger as this length ball climbs above stump height in the corridor. Perfectly in the slot for the ramp and he brings it out to beat long leg
back of a length at off stump, dabbed into the point region off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump. Steps out and doesn't get to the pitch but improvises and taps it strategically between long-off and long-on to come back for the second
good length at leg stump. Can't get to the pitch once more, but this is masterful batting. Nudges it faintly in front of deep midwicket and steals another second
100kph, pushed through at a length on leg stump. Looks to shovel it through backward square. Cops it on the pad
steps out, deceived in flight. But it's a slow pitch and he can adjust and tap this to point
nicely bowled again. Deceives him in the flight, back of a length at off stump. Stretches out and taps it to long-off
googly, back of a length and in at off stump. Slices it to short third man
short ball outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man

there it is. Short ball outside off, swivels quickly and transfers the weight through his back ankle as he makes sweet connection on this hook. It flies flat and just to the left of deep square. Just clears the boundary

good length at off stump, goes straight over the bowler but can't get bat on it. Labuschagne running backwards to field it gets his knee jammed into the turf - taking a piece out - as he puts in a slide. Yikes, that looked bad, but he's alright
short ball gets him flush in the mid-riff as he looks to shovel this fine
short ball at off stump, pulled straight to deep square
expertly scooped from Cooper, but long leg is fine enough to get this. He picked this length ball up from just outside off
starts off nothing like that man though. Short one at off stump, powered to long-on off the back foot
short ball at off stump, cut straight to extra cover
back of a length skidder, chopped to short third man off the outside edge
short ball at off stump, backs into the off side and pulls to deep midwicket's right
short and wide outside off, climbs past the attempted slap off the back foot
tossed up outside off, carted on the up, back past the bowler and to long-off's right. Good running. Big boundaries here means the two is always on
swish. White swings the wand and sends it flying over the long leg fence. Tossed up at a leg stump line and he gets down quickly to send this slow sweep sailing
length ball pitching outside off, strikes him on the back thigh as he looks to sweep. Appeal turned down
short ball down leg side, pulled aerially towards long leg
superbly played. It's full and down leg, and he brings the bat under it quickly to chip it over short fine with what was supposed to originally be a paddle sweep
googly strikes him on the pads as he looks to sweep, but it was going down leg
back of a length in the corridor, run to short third man's left with the turn
back of a length, dug in outside off. Looks to swing across the line, but ends up slicing it over extra cover
back of a length, wide outside off. He lets it go, no way he can get bat on it
clubs through the line and picks this length ball from outside off. Flat, hard and into the practice pitches to the left of wide long-on
shuffles across and lines himself up to punch this full ball past the bowler. Picks up two to long-off's right. That's the way to do it on this ground
back of a length outside off, punched on the up to long-off's right. He slips as he gets down on this and it's two more
back of a length at off stump, gets the ball high on the bat as he looks to punch this. Lobs it towards long-off who is quick this time and keeps them to one

length ball at off stump, opens his body up to try and launch this over midwicket on the rise, but he ends up slicing it high - almost kissing the roof - and straight out to long-off who has a comfortable catch. A well-paced innings from White comes to a close, with the victory in sight
back of a length slower ball, punched back at the bowler who fumbles in his follow through
full at leg stump, poked through the mid-on region on the up
full outside off, carved aerially to sweeper cover
short ball outside off, too close for the cut. Gets a thick outside edge to third man
back of a length in the corridor, punched straight to point
short and into the body, pulled to deep backward square off a thick inside edge
slower short ball at off stump, dragged down to fine leg with a pull
buh-bye! Short ball at the hips, picks it so early, gets in position and swats it far over the long leg boundary
short and in the corridor, under-edges the cut to point's left
brings up the win in style along with his fifty. Cooper repeats the Hodge act. Picks the short ball early before it climbs into his body and swipes to send it sailing over long leg
